comments:
Opening some older libraries results in an error saying the library could not be opened.  The following is in the log file:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Problems encountered while setting project description.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.setDescription(Project.java:983)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.util.ResourceUtil.open(ResourceUtil.java:176)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.services.LibraryProcessor.openLibrary(LibraryProcessor.java:859)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.ui.LibraryUIManager$1.execute(LibraryUIManager.java:263)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.runInCurrentThread(ModalContext.java:369)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.run(ModalContext.java:313)
	at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.ProgressMonitorDialog.run(ProgressMonitorDialog.java:470)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.ui.LibraryUIManager.openLibrary(LibraryUIManager.java:284)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.ui.LibraryUIManager.promptForMethodLibrary(LibraryUIManager.java:153)
	at org.eclipse.epf.authoring.ui.AuthoringUIPlugin.start(AuthoringUIPlugin.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl$2.run(BundleContextImpl.java:995)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.startActivator(BundleContextImpl.java:989)


This problem most likely stems from the fact that the ID of the MethodLibraryNature has changed, but the ResourceUtil class still refers to the old (and wrong) ID.
verified on epf-composer-1.0-M5-N20060810-1810-win32 with Library 7.0,7.0.1,OpenUP_library_20060721 and OpenUP_library_20060728
closed it as verified by QA.

traces.message: Problems encountered while setting project description.
